com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo.v24

Class RelativeVolume

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.id3.pojo.v24.RelativeVolume

  • public class RelativeVolume
extends java.lang.Object
    A relative volume specifies the volume level on a particular speaker channel. It contains the following fields.

    Level Fields
     FieldDescription
    1. channel the speaker channel whose volume will be adjusted.
    2. volume the amount to increase/decrease the volume in db.
    3. num bits in peak volumethe number of bits used to store the peak volume. while the ID3v2.4 spec allows this to be any number between 0 and 255, the Beaglebuddy MP3 library only supports 0 and 32 bit peak volumes.
    4. peak volume the peak volume for the given speaker channel.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RelativeVolume.Channel
      valid ID3v2.4 channel types
      static class  RelativeVolume.PeakVolumeSize
      Peak Volume sizes supported by the Beaglebuddy MP3 library.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RelativeVolume

        public RelativeVolume()
        The default constructor is called when creating a relative volume. The default values used are:
        • other speaker channel
        • 0 db
        • no peak volume

      • RelativeVolume

        Parameters:
        channel - speaker channel
        volume - volume (in db)
        peakVolumeSize - peak volume size.
        peakVolume - peak volume.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double volume)
        set the amount of volume adjustment (in db) for this speaker channel..
        Ex: +2.5 db
        Ex: -3.0 db
        Parameters:
        volume - the amount of volume (in db) to adjust this equalization level.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the volume is not in the range of ±64 db.
        See Also:
        getVolume()

      • getPeakVolumeSize

        public RelativeVolume.PeakVolumeSize getPeakVolumeSize()
        set the number of bits used to store the peak volume. The monkeys who designed the ID3v2.4 spec thought making the number of bits to store the peak volume was a good idea. The Beaglebuddy MP3 library strongly disagrees and hence has restricted the values to either 0, which means no peak volume, or 32 bits.
        Returns:
        the number of bits used to store the peak volume.
        See Also:
        setPeakVolumeSize(PeakVolumeSize)

      • setPeakVolumeSize

        public void setPeakVolumeSize(RelativeVolume.PeakVolumeSize peakVolumeSize)

        Parameters:
        peakVolumeSize - the number of bits used to store the peak volume.
        See Also:
        getPeakVolumeSize()
